channel.title: I've got the firemaking code but I don't know where to put?

item.title: I've got the firemaking code but I don't know where to put?
item.dc:creator: @bo4rdman bo4rdman
item.description:
@bo4rdman wrote:

I ask some lad for the fire making code befor but when he give it me he never told me were to add eny of it could some one help me here are all the codes he gave me I just need help in putting them in the right place :o

[code] // ----tj007razor: firemaking

public int maxFires = 28; // max fires you want a player able to have, can change
public int curFires = 0; // number of fires player has currently
public int fireTimer[] = new int[maxFires]; // how long will the fire stay there?
public int fireX[] = new int[maxFires];
public int fireY[] = new int[maxFires]; // x and y coords of the fire
public boolean canFire = false; // can the player make a new fire yet?

// burn fires out
public void burnFires() {
    for (int q = 0; q < maxFires; q++) {
        if (fireTimer[q] > 0) {
            fireTimer[q]--;
        }
        if (fireTimer[q] == 1) { // deleteobject and tell that there is 1 less fire
            Object(fireX[q], fireY[q], 6951, -1, 10);
            ItemHandler.addItem(592, fireX[q], fireY[q], 1, playerId, false);
            curFires--;
        }
    }
}

// create fires and set timer


public void doFires(int req, int logID) {
    if (playerLevel[11] >= req) {
        if (curFires < maxFires) {
            if (canFire) {
                setAnimation(733);
                sendMessage("You attempt to light the logs...");
                sendMessage(
                        "...the fire catches and the logs begin to burn!");
                deleteItems(logID, 1);
                fireTimer[curFires] = (misc.random(210) + 30); // fires last between 15sec and 2 mins
                fireX[curFires] = absX; // sets x and y to current x and y so the fire can be deleted
                fireY[curFires] = absY; // " "
                Object(absX, absY, 2732, 0, 10); // creates the fire
                curFires++;
                // addSkillXP(multXP*playerLevel[11], 11);
            } else {
                sendMessage("Let your fires burn out before making more.");
            }
        } else {
            sendMessage(
                    "You already have too many fires, wait for some to burn out."); // do not let players excede maxFires
            canFire = false;
        }
    } else {
        sendMessage(
                "You need " + req + "+ firemaking to burn "
                + GetItemName(logID) + " logs."); // if they dont have required level
    }
}

// ----end firemaking[/code] Were do I put this one?

// calls for fire burning, only when needed if (curFires == 0) { canFire = true; } if (curFires > 0) { burnFires(); } Were do this on goâ€¦

// ----tj007razor: firemaking uses // normal logs if (itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1511 || useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1511) { c.doFires(0, 1511); c.addSkillXP(30, 11); } // oak logs if (itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1521 || useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1521) { c.doFires(15, 1521); c.addSkillXP(50, 11); } // willow logs if ((itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1519) || (useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1519)) { c.doFires(30, 1519); c.addSkillXP(70, 11); } // maple logs if ((itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1517) || (useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1517)) { c.doFires(45, 1517); c.addSkillXP(100, 11); } // yew logs if ((itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1515) || (useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1515)) { c.doFires(60, 1515); c.addSkillXP(124, 11); } // magic logs if ((itemUsed == 590 && useWith == 1513) || (useWith == 590 && itemUsed == 1513)) { c.doFires(75, 1513); c.addSkillXP(150, 11); } and this one???

Read full topic
item.source: I've got the firemaking code but I don't know where to put?
